A function that create binned data in .Rda format from raster data in .mat format

! link to raster format and binned format and related two functions

create_binned_data(raster_dir_name, save_prefix_name, bin_width, sampling_interval, start_ind, end_ind, files_contain)

Arguments

save_prefix_name

character. Prefix to the generated name for the created binned file, which is "bin_width_samples_binned_every_sampling_interval_samples
bin_width

integer. The bin width over which raster data is averaged.
sampling_interval

integer. It specifies the nth sample following the start of a bin, where the next bin starts
start_ind

integer. It specifies the sample index where the binning process starts. Due to the structure of raster data in matlab, all sample indices should be positive. By default, all data are included.
end_ind

integer. It specifies the sample index where the binning process should end by. Due to the structure of raster data in matlab, all sample indices should be positive. By default, all data are included.
files_contain

regular expression. Only raster data files that match the file_contains are inlcluded. By default, it is an empty character.
matlab_dir_name

character. Name of a directory containing raster data in .mat format.

Value

Created binned data file will be written to disk. During execution, preceding the binning of each raster file, console spills the total number of raster files will have been binned (as you will see the number increments by one). After the creation of all files, console spills the binned file name.

Examples

Bin the data using 150 sample bins sample at 50 sample intervals
Assumes that raster files are in the directory 'data/Zhang_Desimone_7objects_raster_data_mat/'
and saves the output file with the prefix ZD

#> Error: <text>:1:5: unexpected symbol
#> 1: Bin the
#>         ^
# NOT RUN {
create_binned_data_from_matlab_raster_data(file.path(getwd(),'data/raster/Zhang_Desimone_7objects_raster_data_mat/'), 'data/binned/ZD', 150, 20)
# }
If you get other files mixed in the raster directory that are .mat files and only want to include data from 200th sample to 800th sample

#> Error: <text>:1:4: unexpected symbol
#> 1: If you
#>        ^
# NOT RUN {
create_binned_data_from_matlab_raster_data(file.path(getwd(),'data/raster/Zhang_Desimone_7objects_raster_data_mat/'), 'data/binned/ZD', 150, 20, 200, 800, "\\.mat$")
# }
